descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Methods and concepts of linear and nonlinear optimization theory, going beyond the treatment of optimization in calculus. Topics not usually covered in real analysis, including Kuhn-Tucker Theory, convexity conditions, and linear programming. Fulfills a prerequisite for the Kellogg managerial analytics certificate. Prerequisites: 285-3, 290-3, or 291-3; or both 240 and 300.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
ISBN 978-1118279014
An Introduction to Optimization, 4th ed
Chong and Zak
